text.p: Tourist arrivals in Malta dropped by 7.7 percent in the first seven months of 1996 compared to the same period in 1995, the Central Office of Statistics said on Monday.
The office said the Mediterranean island had 590,793 visitors from January to end-July this year compared to 639,815 in the same period last year.
The office admitted it made a mistake in tourist arrivals figures for May, saying that a computer error had listed the number of arrivals at 84,977 when the proper figure should have been 97,541.
Arrivals in June dropped to 101,061 compared with 110,028 in June 1995. July figures were 123,643 from 134,477 arrivals in 1995.
The drops were mostly in the British and German markets, which are Malta's biggest.
The office said earnings from tourism in the first six months of 1996 reached Lm97 million ($268 million) compared to Lm96.5 million ($266 million) in the first half of 1995. (Lm1 = $2.76)
